extra.message: Nonce verification is weak. Check the return value of wp_verify_nonce() explicitly.
Missing admin capability check. Use current_user_can('manage_options') for admin-only operations.
Capability check without nonce verification. Always verify nonces for form submissions.
REST API endpoint missing capability check. Implement proper permission_callback for security.
File operation missing capability check. Verify user permissions before file operations.
Database operation missing capability check. Verify user permissions before database operations.
Plugin management operation missing capability check. Use 'activate_plugins' or 'install_plugins' capabilities.
User management operation missing capability check. Use appropriate user management capabilities.
Content management operation missing capability check. Use appropriate content management capabilities.
Settings management operation missing capability check. Use 'manage_options' for settings operations.
Multisite operation missing capability check. Use multisite-specific capabilities for network operations.
Multiple capability checks can be optimized. Consider using a single check with multiple capabilities.
User input not sanitized. Use appropriate WordPress sanitization functions before using user data.
REQUEST data not sanitized. Always sanitize REQUEST data before use.
Unsafe output without escaping. Use esc_html(), esc_attr(), or wp_kses_post() for safe output.
Unsafe attribute output. Use esc_attr() for HTML attributes.
Unsafe file path usage. Use sanitize_file_name() for file operations.
Unsafe include/require with user input. Validate and sanitize file paths.
Unsafe URL usage. Use esc_url() for URLs and validate with wp_http_validate_url().
Unsafe link output. Use esc_url() for link href attributes.
Unsafe email usage. Use sanitize_email() for email addresses.
Unsafe JSON output. Use wp_json_encode() and esc_html() for JSON data.
Wrong sanitization function for context. Use appropriate function for the data type and usage.
Unnecessary double sanitization. Avoid sanitizing already sanitized data.
Sanitization without validation. Validate data before sanitizing for better security.
Options update without sanitization. Always sanitize data before saving to options.
User meta update without sanitization. Sanitize data before updating user meta.
Post meta update without sanitization. Sanitize data before updating post meta.
Comment data without sanitization. Use wp_filter_comment() for comment sanitization.
Search query without sanitization. Use sanitize_text_field() for search terms.
File upload without proper validation. Use wp_handle_upload() and validate file types.
Cookie data without sanitization. Always sanitize cookie data before use.
Session data without sanitization. Sanitize session data before use.
AJAX handler missing sanitization. Always sanitize AJAX input data.
AJAX handler missing sanitization. Always sanitize AJAX input data.
Unsafe URL usage. Use esc_url() for URLs and validate with wp_http_validate_url().
Direct SQL query with user input. Use $wpdb->prepare() to prevent SQL injection.
Dynamic table name from user input. Use whitelist validation or hardcoded table names.
SQL query with string concatenation of user input. Use $wpdb->prepare() with placeholders.
LIKE pattern with unsanitized user input. Use $wpdb->esc_like() and $wpdb->prepare().
Misuse of $wpdb->prepare() with string concatenation. Use placeholders for all user input.
